intro: Larnax chotanae, commonly known as the Chotana larnax, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it well adapted to its harsh environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Larnax chotanae is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation.
